! 

In the last 365 days:

F3 speeding up finality by 450x

All thanks to our global community of builders and storage providers!

When does iteration speed on an L1 flip from being an asset to a major risk vector? 

At glif, we like slow change to protocol because it’s safer. If we shipped protocol upgrades every month we’d introduce risk of bugs etc 

Based engineering is the standard, so it’s not an
V1 vs V2 pool

Let’s talk about the FIL+ Problem.
@Filecoin
's "staying power" comes from offering cost effective data storage services for storage clients.

Filecoin's core, proof of replicated data service is useful to certain storage clients, but not all require it. Additionally, storage

The GLIF V2 Pool:

GLIF V2 UPGRADE SUCCESS!

The GLIF V2 Protocol is now live on Filecoin Mainnet! A huge round of applause for the devs 

If you’re a Storage Provider that is actively using GLIF from our command line application, please upgrade to the latest release on GitHub:

For the next week or so, our team is on close watch to find any lurking bugs that we couldn’t catch in our testnet upgrade simulators.

If you see any issues whatsoever, please tag our team members on X, Discord, or Telegram. Please be careful of scammers.

Happy V2'ing y'all!

!

V2 UPDATE 

GLIF V2 Upgrade is scheduled for TOMORROW Wednesday September 4th!!! This is GLIF’s most significant upgrade since its launch over a year ago.

The upgrade window is for the 12 hours between 10am-10pm ET (14:00-02:00 UTC). During this time, all interactions with

FOR DEVELOPERS:

Once the upgrade is complete, we will publish the new InfinityPool smart contract’s address and make an announcement. Please note that the Ramp contract has now been merged with the V2 InfinityPool.

Please let our team know if you experience any bugs or unexpected issues.

This is the last post in our update announcement thread. If you see any more posts from an account that looks like GLIF under this post, it is a scam account, please ignore.
